content.webTitle: Sun set to leave China for Newcastle in £2m deal

fields.headline: Sun set to leave China for Newcastle in £2m deal
fields.bodyText: Newcastle United hope to complete the signing of the China defender Sun Jihai this month for a fee of about £2m. The 24-year-old full-back, who played 23 times for Crystal Palace in the 1998-99 season, had a week's trial at Newcastle last year and would become the first Chinese national to play in the Premiership. "The Newcastle chairman Freddy Shepherd will arrive at Dalian on January 22 to negotiate Sun's move," said Xu Ming, president of Dalian Shide. "We do not envisage any problems." Watford have followed up their free-transfer signing of Middlesbrough's Paul Okon by securing the services of the Arsenal midfielder Jermaine Pennant on a month's loan. Northampton Town's chair man Barry Stonhill yesterday claimed that the sale of the club to the former England striker John Fashanu's company should be completed within 10 days. "The board's view is that Winners World Wide have exciting plans," Stonhill added. "The current board have run out of money." Leicester City have signed the FC Copenhagen and former Derby defender Jacob Laursen, 30, for a fee of about £400,000. He is contracted until the summer of 2004. Sunderland's manager Peter Reid has contacted Valencia about the £7.5m-rated striker John Carew. "I've made an inquiry and it's ongoing," he said. West Ham have agreed a £1m fee with the Czech side Sparta Prague for the Slovak Vladimir Labant. The 27-year-old left-back must pass a medical and obtain a work permit. Dundee have expressed fears for the safety of their players after Wednesday's attack on Patrizio Billio outside Dens Park. Police are keen to talk to a shaven-haired man in his late 20s or early 30s who was in the area at the time. Billio and his fellow Italian Marco de Marchi, who witnessed the attack, are in dispute with the club after being fined £20,000 for failing to turn up for an Intertoto Cup tie in June 2000. Billio last played for the first team in November 2000, De Marchi in March 2001.
